column1: It's the first Thanksgiving in my life I don’t want to spend with my parents because the risk is too great—but I’m thankful they are alive & well. For more than 250000 American families the empty spots at the table this year are a grim reminder of the devastating toll of COVID19
The United States just set a record for new coronavirus cases in one day: 77640. And President Trump still doesn't have a plan. https://t.co/PSTpzSVtNs

Whether it’s coronavirus or forest fires the president’s message is “you’re on your own"—the antithesis of our nation's motto: "Out of many one."   It’s time for a leader who will prevent crises rather than politicize them. Joe Biden will restore empathy to the White House. https://t.co/30LoVUEipg

Gold Star families have already suffered unspeakable tragedy. For the President to suggest it's their fault he contracted Coronavirus when he has been flouting medical advice since day one of the pandemic would be laughable if it weren't so reprehensible. https://t.co/F7yR9adCBH
Because of Covid-19 Trump called himself a wartime president but he didn’t heed his generals and never ordered ammunition. https://t.co/YyDloW47Sx

On Jan. 28 Trump was told coronavirus would be "the biggest national security threat" of his presidency. Just days before he said "We have it under control. It's going to be just fine." https://t.co/sHiJ4rPcgq
The coronavirus and the president’s trade war are a one-two punch against our fishermen. I’m going to keep fighting back with them. https://t.co/NleU9oKqC1

When I heard about the first death of a grocery store worker from Coronavirus I got on the phone with the governor and asked that they be classified essential in order to get priority testing. It was done the next day. https://t.co/qGi2DxHxxe
Reminder that the Trump administration is trying to hide COVID data from the public: https://t.co/9h0VfZv1vt
Why is the MLB taking Coronavirus more seriously than Republicans in Congress? https://t.co/AidlydlRTY
Coronavirus has disrupted our lives in ways we never could have predicted. This is an opportunity to think big transform our country and come out stronger on the other side. https://t.co/uq6VL6aL10

I'm glad that we could help @NortheastArc locate this shipment. Nonprofits and states in the richest country on Earth should be focused on the response to coronavirus not competing against each other for protective equipment. https://t.co/IIiMC3rQyR
I'm hosting a virtual conversation today at 5 pm in partnership with Samaritans of Boston to discuss access to mental health resources during coronavirus. Join us at https://t.co/pwkF1svR5v

Thanks @SECupp for nominating me in the #COVID19challenge. I'm supporting the @UnitedWayMABay Lynn Community Care Fund and @projectbread and I nominate @EnesKanter @SRuhle and @AmyMcGrathKY to keep it going. https://t.co/1s0awzhHDs
I'm live now with AG @maura_healey to talk about how to protect yourself from scams and cybercrimes during coronavirus. Tune in with your questions! https://t.co/5uiiRkMyOz https://t.co/2gNpY2Ob6m

We know about the public health consequences of COVID-19 but the pandemic leaves us vulnerable in other ways too. I’m looking forward to joining @Maura_Healey for a conversation on how to protect yourself from online threats in the age of coronavirus. https://t.co/U97zvylLsJ

I’m looking forward to being joined by @LaurenUnderwood tomorrow on Facebook Live to share her perspective on the #COVID19 crisis as a registered nurse and public health professional. Join us at 3:30 PM ET. https://t.co/2FzoDzdmkm
So glad to not be socially distant from this beautiful woman on her BIRTHDAY! Happy birthday Liz I love you! https://t.co/WljiL1jYoE

Looking forward to catching up with @EnesKanter on how he's staying in shape—physically and mentally—during coronavirus. Tune in on Facebook live tomorrow at 7 pm. https://t.co/2FzoDzuXIW https://t.co/bKMMvwvGeQ

I sent a letter to the Trump administration more than a month ago asking what the @DeptofDefense is doing to protect our armed forces from COVID-19. I still haven't heard back from them but it looks like the answer is clearly not enough. https://t.co/Z6LvJ43cqq

History will remember that President Trump chose to ignore the threat of the coronavirus. We need to make sure Americans remember that decision when they make theirs at the polls this November. https://t.co/4ddksyrv2C
No one should die of COVID-19 because they are in jail. We must ensure people in the criminal justice system aren't being overlooked in this crisis. https://t.co/MFx5xLCAcB

I strongly support the @PIH contact tracing efforts announced by @MassGovernor today. I’m lucky to count Dr. Paul Farmer as a member of my Coronavirus Advisory Team. PIH’s efforts led by some of the most experienced people in the world will save lives. https://t.co/blBAiAUidz
Coronavirus testing and treatment should be free. https://t.co/t8vJ500Dzx

We all have a part to play in fighting #coronavirus. Congress is acting today to help hospitals & health care workers. MA-businesses are stepping up where they can. I’m proud of the work of @ColinAngle and @iRobot who donated some surgical masks locally.
My statement on the House resolution condemning the Chinese government's response to COVID-19. https://t.co/WGCfTIW69L
This is the right call @MassGovernor. We all must do our part to stop the spread of COVID-19. Stay home. https://t.co/5UntvFYyup

We know the best way to stop #coronavirus is to stay home. A statewide shelter in place is the right thing to do. If Governor Baker ordered this I would strongly support it and I know several North Shore mayors would too.

.@DeptVetAffairs responsible for more than 9 million patients has administered 322 coronavirus tests. Our veterans deserve better than this. We need to increase testing everywhere especially within the VA. https://t.co/tMVSlFqm8C
The Utah Jazz have administered 58 Coronavirus tests. https://t.co/YjxXWcbzdk
.@JoeBiden's coronavirus plan is comprehensive rational and most importantly based in fact. This is great guidance for local state and federal leaders. https://t.co/vVEJeI8UF2

We are currently operating at Level 2 but are vigilantly monitoring the situation and prepared to shift if necessary. I’m confident that implementing guidelines such as these will significantly slow the spread of COVID-19.

It’s important we react to COVID-19 in a measured but decisive manner. That’s why I’ve developed and implemented a comprehensive plan for my team that I hope can serve as an example for others. Our response operates on three levels:
I'm thankful the Vice President is listening to the experts taking the threat of Coronavirus seriously and acting accordingly.  This is how a leader responds in a crisis. https://t.co/LSMe5G10X3
Public health emergencies require leaders we can trust. This is how the president should be talking about #coronavirus. https://t.co/QqgXqHbymN
Good news: Mike Pence who doesn't believe in evolution or climate change (science!) is in charge of managing Coronavirus. Problem solved! https://t.co/pVVQs36UqU
